text.div:
Medications (example) - IPS

This value set provides an example of possible coded concepts representing:

  • medicinal products
  • packaged medicinal products
  • medications based on their generic composition of:
    • active substance(s) (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 1)
    • active substance(s) with strength (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 2)
    • active substance(s) with administrable dose form (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 3)
    • active substance(s) with strength and administrable dose form (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 4)

Please note that this Value set is not representing any IDMP identifier. It is envisioned that a future version will be based on the IDMP IDs when available for actual use.

Copyright Statement:

Copyright statements for terminologies included in this artifact:

  • This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyrighted material of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Where an implementation of this artefact makes use of SNOMED CT content, the implementer must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/get-snomed-ct or info@snomed.org
  • National Drug Code (NDC). NDC is copyright Food and Drug Administration. Terms & Conditions in https://www.fda.gov/drugs/drug-approvals-and-databases/national-drug-code-directory.
  • RxNorm. RxNorm is copyright Unified Medical Language System® (UMLS®). Terms & Conditions in https://uts.nlm.nih.gov/license.html https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm/docs/termsofservice.html.
  • Autorizzazione all'Immissione in Commercio (AIC). AIC is owned by the Italian Medicines Agency (AIFA). Terms & Conditions in https://www.aifa.gov.it/copyright.
  • Code Identifiant de Spécialité (CIS). CIS is owned by the French Ministry of Solidarity and Health. Terms & Conditions in https://solidarites-sante.gouv.fr/soins-et-maladies/medicaments/glossaire/article/code-cis
  • Include these codes as defined in http://snomed.info/sct

    774587000Amoxicillin and clavulanic acid only product
    776556004Lithium citrate only product
    774409003Acenocoumarol only product
    780130002Acetaminophen only product in rectal dose form
    778315007Amoxicillin and clavulanic acid only product in oral dose form
    779725005Lithium citrate only product in oral dose form
    778207007Acenocoumarol only product in oral dose form
    322257001Paracetamol 250 mg rectal suppository
    392259005Amoxicillin 875 mg and clavulanic acid (as clavulanate potassium) 125 mg oral tablet
    766489003Lithium citrate 104 mg/mL oral solution
    319740004Acenocoumarol 1 mg oral tablet
  • Include these codes as defined in http://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm
    CodeDisplay
    331055Amoxicillin 1000 MG
    437158Acetaminophen 100 MG
    332122lithium citrate 60 MG/ML
  • Include these codes as defined in http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ndc
    CodeDisplay
    50436-3129Amoxicillin and Clavulanate Potassium 875 mg/1 125 mg/1 TABLET, FILM COATED
  • Include these codes as defined in http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ndc
    CodeDisplay
    50436-3129-1Amoxicillin and Clavulanate Potassium 875 mg/1 125 mg/1 20 TABLET, FILM COATED in 1 BOTTLE (50436-3129-1)

title: Medications (example) - IPS
publisher: Health Level Seven International - Patient Care Work Group
description:
This value set provides an example of possible coded concepts representing:  
* medicinal products  
* packaged medicinal products  
* medications based on their generic composition of:   
  * active substance(s) (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 1)  
  * active substance(s) with strength (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 2)  
  * active substance(s) with administrable dose form (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 3)   
  * active substance(s) with strength and administrable dose form (e.g. IDMP PhPID Active Substance Stratum Level 4)
  

Please note that this Value set is not representing any IDMP identifier. It is envisioned that a future version will be based on the IDMP IDs when available for actual use.
